title: Channel 10 CONFIRMS season two of The Masked Singer
text:
She has been condemned for her 'diva-like behaviour' on set of The Masked Singer Australia.

But Lindsay Lohan is not going to be replaced on the show, with all four celebrity judges set to return to the franchise next year.

On Thursday, Channel 10's chief content officer Beverley McGarvey confirmed a second season, telling News.com.au: 'Despite what you may have read, we will have exactly the same judging lineup and exactly the same host.'

It's official! The Masked Singer will return for a second season in 2020, along with all four judges: Jackie 'O' Henderson, Dannii Minogue, Dave Hughes and Lindsay Lohan

McGarvey said the network is 'thrilled [all the judges] are coming back', adding that season two of The Masked singer 'will be really exciting'.

The karaoke game show judged by Jackie 'O' Henderson, Dannii Minogue, Dave Hughes and Lindsay Lohan has been a ratings hit for Channel 10 over the past few weeks.

However, these figures took a slight dip on Monday and Tuesday, which industry experts believe may be due to the calibre of celebrities being unmasked on the show.

The final word: 'Despite what you may have read, we will have exactly the same judging lineup and exactly the same host,' said Beverley McGarvey, Channel 10's chief content officer

'I think the ambition for us next year would be to cast [The Masked Singer] differently so that we [are] surprising people in different ways,' acknowledged McGarvey.

On Tuesday, Lindsay revealed on the Hughesy & Kate radio show that she has a surprise in store for viewers next year.

'For season two I'm bringing an American with me,' she said.

The Yanks are taking over! Lindsay said earlier this week that she will be 'bringing an American' with her for season two of The Masked Singer

On Wednesday, Lindsay exclusively told DailyMail.com she 'loves the Masked Singer' and urged fans not to believe the 'lies' being told about her.

The 'lies' she is referring to were published earlier in the week by New Idea, which claimed the network was replacing her due to her 'tricky demands'.

The Masked Singer continues Monday at 7.30pm on Channel 10
